strings.user_list_disable_da: Are you sure you want to disable this Domain Admin and all of the associated Domains and End Users?
strings.user_list_disable_eu: Are you sure you want to disable this user?
strings.user_list_delete_one_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this user?
strings.user_list_delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete the selected user(s)?
strings.user_list_hlp_long_sa:
The Users list displays all users that are currently configured in the account.
Server Admin refers to the administrator of the virtual private server and the primary server domain (usually the domain the server was provisioned with).
Domain Admin refers to a user that administers at least one virutal host domain.
End User refers to a user that is created with mail and/or file storage on a virtual host domain or the server domain.Server disk space information is displayed as a total for the Server Admin or Domain Admin associated with the current list view. Disk space information is also displayed for individual users in the list. This information is updated each time the list is filtered.
Disabling a user
Disabling a user temporarily disables the user's account. While disabled, a user will not be able to retrieve mail or access the account through the Control Panel, FTP or shell (telnet or ssh). Disabling a Domain Admin will automatically disable all virtual host domains and End Users that belong to the Domain Admin's account. User settings and mail are not deleted when the user is disabled.
Deleting a user
Deleting a user permanently removes all of the user's information and mail from the server. The system cannot delete a Domain Admin until all virtual host domains are deleted from the Domain Admin's account.
strings.user_list_hlp_long_da:
Your Users list displays all users that are currently configured in your account.
Server disk space information is displayed as a total for your account and individually for your users in the list. This information is updated each time the list is filtered.
Disabling a user
Disabling a user temporarily disables the user's account. While disabled, a user will not be able to retrieve mail or access the account through the Control Panel, FTP or shell (telnet or ssh). User settings and mail are not deleted when the user is disabled.
Deleting a user
Deleting a user permanently removes all of the user's information and mail from the server.
strings.user_properties_instr1: Select edit to update properties of the
strings.user_properties_da_hlp_long:
The Properties summarizes the current Domain Admin settings.
Changing User Settings
Select Edit to change the settings or preferences for this Domain Admin.
strings.user_properties_eu_hlp_long:
The Properties summarizes the current End User settings.
Changing User Settings
Select Edit to change the settings or preferences for this End User.
strings.user_edit_profile_instr: Edit the profile information for the Domain Admin.
strings.user_edit_profile_eu_hlp_long:
Changing the Password
The Password is used for Control Panel, FTP and email authentication. If you change this password, the user should be notified accordingly. If you do not wish to change the existing password, leave the New Password and Confirm Password fields blank.
Allocating Disk Space
User Disk Space is the amount of space on the virtual host domain allocated for the End User's file storage and mail storage. The End User's usage may not exceed the amount allocated.
Granting Privileges
The End User Privileges that are available to grant to End Users are determined by the privileges enabled in the Domain Admin account.
Mail creates a mailbox for the user on the server.
FTP Access gives the user access to a personal home directory for file storage on the domain, and the ability to transfer files to and from the directory using an FTP client.
Shell Access allows the user to access account functions using a shell program (telnet or ssh).
strings.user_edit_profile_da_hlp_long:
Changing the Password
The Password is used for Control Panel, FTP and email authentication. If you change this password, the user should be notified accordingly. If you do not wish to change the existing password, leave the New Password and Confirm Password fields blank.
Allocating Disk Space
User Disk Space is the amount of space on the server allocated to the Domain Admin's account for virtual host websites, log files, file storage and mail storage.
Granting Privileges
Granting a privilege to a Domain Admin enables the privilege for the Domain Admin user and enables the Domain Admin to grant the privilege to End Users.
Mail creates a mailbox for the user on the server. Enabling the Mail privilege for a Domain Admin gives the Domain Admin an email address on the server domain, and an email address on all of the virtual host domains added to the Domain Admin's account.
FTP Access gives the user access to a personal home directory for file storage on the domain, and the ability to transfer files to and from the directory using an FTP client. Granting this privilege to a Domain Admin grants the Domain Admin FTP access to the document root for each domain in the Domain Admin's account.
Shell Access allows the user to access account functions using a shell program (telnet or ssh).
strings.user_edit_mail_hlp_long:
Edit Mail Setup enables you to change the settings for the user's mailbox.
Enabling Mail Applications
Mail Applications define the set of mail-related applications that will be offered in the user's mail account.
Webmail is a web email program that enables the user to read and manage email messages using any web browser. If the Webmail client is not enabled, the user must access the email account using a standard email client application. If Webmail is enabled, both Webmail and a standard email client may be used.
SpamAssassin is a service that uses heuristic tests on incoming mail messages to identify unsolicited commercial email. If the user subscribes to SpamAssassin, suspected junk mail is filtered to the user's Junk folder.
ClamAV is a free anti-virus tool designed to scan and filter email. Email messages that contain viruses or other threats will be filtered to your Quarantine mail folder.
strings.user_edit_logout_hlp_long:
Changing the Logout Preference
The Logout setting is a security feature that defines the amount of time the account may be idle before the user will be automatically logged out of the Control Panel.

strings.user_profile_js_error_fullname_fmt_chars: The Full Name contains an invalid character. A valid Full Name cannot contain a colon, comma, equal sign, or quotation mark.
strings.user_profile_js_error_loginid_fmt_chars: The Login ID contains an invalid character. A valid Login ID consists of up to 16 characters, including lowercase letters, numbers, underscores, hyphens, and dots. It must not begin with a hyphen or dot.
strings.user_profile_js_error_loginid_fmt_start: The first character of the Login ID is invalid. A Login ID must not begin with a hyphen or dot.

strings.user_profile_js_error_password_login_mat: Password should not match Login ID.
strings.user_profile_js_error_password_match: Password and Confirm Password must match.
strings.user_profile_js_error_quota_fmt: User Disk Space must be an integer value greater than or equal to 0 MB.
strings.user_profile_js_warning_quota_zero: You have assigned 0 MB of disk space to this user. The user's disk space usage will only be limited by the Domain Admin quota. You need to check whether it is allowed under the Domain Admin profile.
strings.user_profile_js_error_quota_exceeded: User Disk Space must be less than or equal to the admin quota.
strings.user_profile_js_error_domain_fmt: The Domain must be of the form "domain.com".
strings.user_profile_js_error_daps: At least one Domain Admin privilege is required.
strings.user_profile_js_error_eups: At least one End User privilege is required.
strings.user_profile_js_error_euprefix_fmt_start: Prefix starts with an invalid character.
strings.user_add_da_profile_hlp_long:
A Domain Admin is a user that administers at least one virtual host domain.
Allocating Disk Space
User Disk Space is the amount of space on the server allocated to the Domain Admin's account for virtual host websites, log files, file storage and mail storage. The Domain Admin's usage may exceed the amount allocated.
Granting Privileges
Granting a privilege to a Domain Admin enables the privilege for the Domain Admin user and enables the Domain Admin to grant the privilege to End Users.
Mail creates a mailbox for the user on the server. Enabling the Mail privilege for a Domain Admin gives the Domain Admin an email address on the server domain, and an email address on all of the virtual host domains added to the Domain Admin's account.
FTP Access gives the user access to a personal home directory for file storage on the domain, and the ability to transfer files to and from the directory using an FTP client. Granting this privilege to a Domain Admin grants the Domain Admin FTP access to the document root for each domain in the Domain Admin's account.
Shell Access allows the user to access account functions using a shell program (telnet or ssh).
strings.user_add_da_domain_hlp_long:
Domain Setup defines the attributes for the initial virtual host domain created for the Domain Admin's account. Additional virtual host domains may be added to the account later.
Enabling Web Services
CGI permits CGI scripts in the cgi-bin directory for the domain.
SSL allows secure HTTPS connections using a shared certificate.
Configuring Website Logs
Website logs are text files that record visitors' requests for web pages, images, and other files or programs. All requests are logged in a file named access_log. Website logs must be created and stored if a third party statistics program is used.
strings.user_add_ma_profile_hlp_long:
An Mail Admin is a user that is created with mail and/or file storage on a domain.
Allocating Disk Space
User Disk Space is the amount of space on the virtual host domain allocated for the Mail Admin's file storage and mail storage. The Mail Admin's usage may not exceed the amount allocated.
Granting Privileges
The Mail Admin Privileges that are available for you to grant to Mail Admins are determined by the privileges enabled for the account. One or more of the following privileges will appear on your form.
Mail creates a mailbox for the user on the server.
FTP Access gives the user access to a personal home directory for file storage on the domain, and the ability to transfer files to and from the directory using an FTP client.
Shell Access allows the user to access account functions using a shell program (telnet or ssh).
strings.user_add_eu_profile_hlp_long:
An End User is a user that is created with mail and/or file storage on a domain.
Allocating Disk Space
User Disk Space is the amount of space on the virtual host domain allocated for the End User's file storage and mail storage. The End User's usage may not exceed the amount allocated.
Granting Privileges
The End User Privileges that are available for you to grant to End Users are determined by the privileges enabled for the account. One or more of the following privileges will appear on your form.
Mail creates a mailbox for the user on the server.
FTP Access gives the user access to a personal home directory for file storage on the domain, and the ability to transfer files to and from the directory using an FTP client.
Shell Access allows the user to access account functions using a shell program (telnet or ssh).

Enter the initial Email Address and select Mail Applications for the user's mailbox.

strings.cp_instr_user_add_eu_mail_apps: Offer the End User the following mail-related applications and services:
strings.user_add_mail_apps_clamav_installed_as_m: Note: Clam AntiVirus is installed at the system level. As a result, all users are subscribed to ClamAV.
strings.user_add_mail_forward_mail: Forward mail to the following email address(es)
strings.user_add_mail_save_forward: Save a copy of forwarded mail on the server.
strings.user_mail_js_error_email_fmt: The Email Address must be a valid email address format.
strings.user_mail_js_error_forward_err: At least one forwarding destination is required.
strings.user_add_mail_hlp_long:
Mail Setup defines a user's mailbox.
Enabling Mail Applications
Mail Applications define the set of mail-related applications that will be offered in the user's mail account.
Webmail is a web email program that enables the user to read and manage email messages using any web browser. If the Webmail client is not enabled, the user must access the email account using a standard email client application. If Webmail is enabled, both Webmail and a standard email client may be used.
SpamAssassin is a service that uses heuristic tests on incoming mail messages to identify unsolicited commercial email. If the user subscribes to SpamAssassin, suspected junk mail is filtered to the user's Junk folder.
ClamAV is a free anti-virus tool designed to scan and filter email. Email messages that contain viruses or other threats will be filtered to your Quarantine mail folder.
Forwarding Mail
Forwarding the user's mail to an established email address is recommended until the user is able to access the mailbox through the domain. This setting may be changed by the user in Mailbox Options.
strings.cp_instr_user_add_domain: Define the web services, the number of users and email addresses, and the website log settings for the virtual host domain.
strings.user_add_domain_eu_hlp: Allow the Domain Admin to create:
strings.user_add_domain_unlimited_eu: An unlimited number of end users.
strings.user_add_domain_eu_prefix_hlp: Prepend all Login IDs that Domain Admin creates with the following prefix:
strings.user_add_domain_email_hlp: Allow the Domain Admin to create:
strings.user_add_domain_unlimited_email: An unlimited number of email addresses.
strings.user_add_domain_logs_no_create: Do not create or store website logs.
strings.user_add_domain_mail_catchall_reject: Reject mail - return as unknown user.
strings.user_add_domain_error_invalid_domain: The Domain must be a valid domain name format
strings.user_add_domain_error_invalid_domain_ali: Each Domain Alias must be specified in a valid domain name format
strings.user_add_domain_error_null_eus: A value for maximum end users is required.
strings.user_add_domain_error_fmt_eus: The value for the maximum end users must be an integer value greater than or equal to zero.
strings.user_add_domain_error_null_ems: A value for maximum email addresses is required.
strings.user_add_domain_error_fmt_ems: The value for the maximum email addresses must be an integer value greater than or equal to zero.
strings.user_add_domain_error_invalid_contact: The Domain Contact must be a valid email address format
strings.user_add_domain_error_null_catchall: A Mail Catchall delivery email address is required.
strings.user_add_domain_error_invalid_catchall: The Mail Catchall delivery destination must be a valid email address format
strings.user_add_domain_hlp_long:
Adding a virtual host domain to a user's account
You may add a virtual host domain to two types of user accounts:
Existing Domain Admins
End Users of the primary server domain
Enabling Web Services
You may enable CGI and SSL services for each domain:
CGI permits CGI scripts in the cgi-bin directory for the domain.
SSL allows secure HTTPS connections using a shared certificate.
Configuring Website Logs
Website logs are text files that record visitors' requests for web pages, images, and other files or programs. All requests are logged in a file named domain_name-access_log. Website logs must be created and stored if a third party statistics program is used.
strings.cp_instr_user_add_da_preview_1: Preview, Edit and Save the Domain Admin you just defined.
strings.cp_instr_user_add_ma_preview_1: Preview, Edit and Save the Mail Admin you just defined.
strings.cp_instr_user_add_eu_preview_1: Preview, Edit and Save the End User you just defined.
strings.cp_instr_user_add_preview_2: Select Save to add this user to your account.
strings.user_add_preview_domain_ws_logs_no: Do not create or store website logs
strings.user_add_preview_domain_catchall_1: Reject mail - return as unknown user
strings.user_add_da_preview_hlp_long:
The Preview summarizes the current Domain Admin settings.
Changing User Settings
The Domain Admin account is not created until you select Save or Save / Create Another. You may change the information you have entered by selecting Previous to step backward through the form.
strings.user_add_ma_preview_hlp_long:
The Preview summarizes the current Domain Admin settings.
Changing User Settings
The Domain Admin account is not created until you select Save or Save / Create Another. You may change the information you have entered by selecting Previous to step backward through the form.
strings.user_add_eu_preview_hlp_long:
The Preview summarizes the current End User settings.
Changing User Settings
The End User account is not created until you select Save or Save / Create Another. You may change the information you have entered by selecting Previous to step backward through the form.
